result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier Rizo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 316 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any co-actor, victim/witness or their residences.
Attend Criminal Thinking course.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns, pubs, and liquor stores)

AS OF 2/03/2016: RESTITUTION WAS ADDED IN THE AMOUNT OF $397,329.38 (jointly and severally w/co-defendants) As follows: $388,000.00 - to Ms. A. Gunderson, $47.68 for doctor visits, $4,901.75 for lost wages, $679.47 for the Safe, $150.00 for a sweater and 2 blankets, $435.14 for Gun fees and permit, and $3,115.34 for Alarm system. 
25% to come out of prison wages to be applied to Restitution,  not any monies deposited from the outside of the prison. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. Civil Judgment to be taken if not paid.

Defendant Javier Rizo in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steven Biskupic on behalf of the victim. Parties stipulate to the restitution amount of $629.11 owed to Mr. Gunderson. Court grants and orders that amount jointly and severally.  Antoinette Gunderson was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense. Jeffrey Gunderson was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense. Detective Stephen Westphal was sworn and testified. Cross examination by the defense.  Court orders restitution jointly and severally regarding Ms. Gunderson in the amount of $388,000.00 plus
$47.68 doctor visits
$4901.75 lost wages
$679.47 for the safe
$150.00 for a sweater and 2 blankets
$435.14 gun fees and permit
$3115.34 Alarm System
TOTAL $397,329.38
FRUTHER ORDERED court does sign the orders regarding the Quick Claim Deed regarding the homes and order regarding the vehicle and copies of said orders provided to Attorney Biskupic. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that any restitution paid, only 25% be taken out of their prison pay, not any monies deposited from the outside of prison.

Defendant Javier Rizo in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.   Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Victim makes statements to the court.  Court imposed the following sentence:


  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 316 days)
  -  5 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  any co-actor, victim/witness or their residences
*Attend Criminal Thinking
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*No presence at any establishment whose primary business is serving/selling alcohol
 
RESTITUTION:  To be determined

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
